heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 04 September 2025, lasting 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.2°C) and feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 12 mbar) and light levels (up 3046 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 4.7°C), dew point temperature (up 3.0°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and outside temperature (up 4.0°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 155.4m higher than yesterday, 459.0m higher than the past week, 547.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 767m and a peak of 3570m, averaging 2010m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and periods of sunshine are expected. Little change in the weather.
